settings.page_title: Discover the Le Pigalle, Paris Shop
settings.text: We have partnered with one of our favourite destinations Le Pigalle in Paris! Together we have curated the ultimate festive shop. Explore the limited edition collection of merchandise designed by famed tattoo artist Jean Andre, glassware by Anissa Kermiche, and beautiful statement lighting from Charlotte Perriand.

settings.text_block:
White Cotton Graphic Tote Bag, Jean André x Le Pigalle

Grocery shopping’s no fun. But thanks to this graphic cotton tote bag, you can do it in style. Its ample size makes days out in the city a dream, able to hold everything you need. And with a bold graphic lip print and a short, easy-to-grab handle, it’s been designed for both form and function.

This piece is part of a collaboration between artist Jean André and Le Pigalle – a spot loved by creatives, his illustrations and posters are well-loved on Instagram, and thanks to this tote bag’s playful design, even the most mundane of days can become an Instagram-worthy moment.

settings.title: 2. Cornerstone
settings.text_block:
3 Prince Edward Rd, E9 5NP
Head chef: James Toth
Order the: Pickled oysters

If something low-key but nevertheless delicious is more your style, then Tom Brown’s solo debut, Cornerstone, should be your first point of call. His produce-driven approach sees seafood as the star of the show, while a seat at the bar offers an unparalleled view of the chefs at work.
